Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: total carbon
Attribute.Description: total carbon content

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: turbidity
Attribute.Description: turbidity measurement

Attribute.Name: water content
Attribute.Description: water content measurement

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: タイトルはサンプルをよく表す簡潔なものを記入します。 タイトルはアカウントから登録されたサンプルにおいてユニークである必要があります。 例: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: NCBI Taxonomy database，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert，taiga，deciduous woodland。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 局所的な環境。例：harbor，cliff，lake。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air，soil，water。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 海抜上の地表面から空中にあるサンプルを採取した位置までの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: ammonium
Attribute.Description: concentration of ammonium

Attribute.Name: biomass
Attribute.Description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

Attribute.Name: bromide
Attribute.Description: concentration of bromide

Attribute.Name: calcium
Attribute.Description: concentration of calcium

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chloride
Attribute.Description: concentration of chloride

Attribute.Name: chlorophyll
Attribute.Description: concentration of chlorophyll

Attribute.Name: density
Attribute.Description: density of sample

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: diether lipids
Attribute.Description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Attribute.Name: dissolved carbon dioxide
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

Attribute.Name: dissolved hydrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic carbon
Attribute.Description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

Attribute.Name: dissolved oxygen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを採取した場所の標高。平均海面からの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: nitrite
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrite

Attribute.Name: nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

Attribute.Name: organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic carbon

Attribute.Name: organic matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic matter

Attribute.Name: organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: phospholipid fatty acid
Attribute.Description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: potassium
Attribute.Description: concentration of potassium

Attribute.Name: pressure
Attribute.Description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity measurement

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.Description: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.Description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: silicate
Attribute.Description: concentration of silicate

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 核酸抽出とシークエンスに使用された実験材料に対する ID。採取された元々の材料，もしくは，そこから派生したサンプルを参照する ID を記載することができます。

Attribute.Name: sulfate
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfate

Attribute.Name: sulfide
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfide

Attribute.Name: Fhost
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: water current
Attribute.Description: measurement of magnitude and direction of flow within a fluid

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: タイトルはサンプルをよく表す簡潔なものを記入します。 タイトルはアカウントから登録されたサンプルにおいてユニークである必要があります。 例: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: NCBI Taxonomy database，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert，taiga，deciduous woodland。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 局所的な環境。例：harbor，cliff，lake。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air，soil，water。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが取得された生物の (ラボではなく) 自然界での宿主。"Homo sapiens" のように学名を記載。

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: air temperature regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 海抜上の地表面から空中にあるサンプルを採取した位置までの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: antibiotic regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chemical mutagen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

Attribute.Name: climate environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを採取した場所の標高。平均海面からの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: fertilizer regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

Attribute.Name: fungicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

Attribute.Name: gaseous environment
Attribute.Description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

Attribute.Name: gravity
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

Attribute.Name: growth hormone regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

Attribute.Name: growth media
Attribute.Description: information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples

Attribute.Name: herbicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリング時の宿主の年齢

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. For the controlled vocabulary, please see Human Disease Ontology, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or MeSH, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 宿主の病気の名称。(例：Salmonella gastroenteritis) Controlled vocabulary としては以下のオントロジーを参照: Human Disease Ontology，http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009，MeSH，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: host dry mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of dry mass

Attribute.Name: host height
Attribute.Description: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host infra specific name
Attribute.Description: taxonomic information subspecies level

Attribute.Name: host infra specific rank
Attribute.Description: taxonomic rank information below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

Attribute.Name: host length
Attribute.Description: the length of subject

Attribute.Name: host life stage
Attribute.Description: description of host life stage

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host, e.g. 9606
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 宿主の NCBI Taxonomy identifier

Attribute.Name: host total mass
Attribute.Description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Attribute.Name: host wet mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of wet mass

Attribute.Name: humidity regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: mechanical damage
Attribute.Description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

Attribute.Name: mineral nutrient regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: non mineral nutrient regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pesticide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

Attribute.Name: pH regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

Attribute.Name: plant body site
Attribute.Description: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO

Attribute.Name: plant product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: radiation regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

Attribute.Name: rainfall regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: salt regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.Description: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.Description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: seasonal environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 核酸抽出とシークエンスに使用された実験材料に対する ID。採取された元々の材料，もしくは，そこから派生したサンプルを参照する ID を記載することができます。

Attribute.Name: standing water regimen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: Fhost
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: tissue culture growth media
Attribute.Description: description of plant tissue culture growth media used

Attribute.Name: water temperature regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: watering regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: タイトルはサンプルをよく表す簡潔なものを記入します。 タイトルはアカウントから登録されたサンプルにおいてユニークである必要があります。 例: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: NCBI Taxonomy database，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを採取した場所の標高。平均海面からの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert，taiga，deciduous woodland。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 局所的な環境。例：harbor，cliff，lake。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air，soil，water。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: alkyl diethers
Attribute.Description: concentration of alkyl diethers

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 海抜上の地表面から空中にあるサンプルを採取した位置までの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: aminopeptidase activity
Attribute.Description: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

Attribute.Name: ammonium
Attribute.Description: concentration of ammonium

Attribute.Name: bacterial carbon production
Attribute.Description: measurement of bacterial carbon production

Attribute.Name: biomass
Attribute.Description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

Attribute.Name: bishomohopanol
Attribute.Description: concentration of bishomohopanol

Attribute.Name: bromide
Attribute.Description: concentration of bromide

Attribute.Name: calcium
Attribute.Description: concentration of calcium

Attribute.Name: carbon/nitrogen ratio
Attribute.Description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chloride
Attribute.Description: concentration of chloride

Attribute.Name: chlorophyll
Attribute.Description: concentration of chlorophyll

Attribute.Name: density
Attribute.Description: density of sample

Attribute.Name: diether lipids
Attribute.Description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Attribute.Name: dissolved carbon dioxide
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

Attribute.Name: dissolved hydrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic carbon
Attribute.Description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

Attribute.Name: dissolved oxygen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

Attribute.Name: glucosidase activity
Attribute.Description: measurement of glucosidase activity

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: magnesium
Attribute.Description: concentration of magnesium

Attribute.Name: mean friction velocity
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean friction velocity

Attribute.Name: mean peak friction velocity
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

Attribute.Name: methane
Attribute.Description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: n alkanes
Attribute.Description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: nitrite
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrite

Attribute.Name: nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

Attribute.Name: organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic carbon

Attribute.Name: organic matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic matter

Attribute.Name: organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: particulate organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of particulate organic carbon

Attribute.Name: particle classification
Attribute.Description: particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories: clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: petroleum hydrocarbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: phaeopigments
Attribute.Description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: phospholipid fatty acid
Attribute.Description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: porosity
Attribute.Description: porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

Attribute.Name: potassium
Attribute.Description: concentration of potassium

Attribute.Name: pressure
Attribute.Description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

Attribute.Name: redox potential
Attribute.Description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity measurement

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.Description: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.Description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: sediment type
Attribute.Description: information about the sediment type based on major constituents

Attribute.Name: silicate
Attribute.Description: concentration of silicate

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 核酸抽出とシークエンスに使用された実験材料に対する ID。採取された元々の材料，もしくは，そこから派生したサンプルを参照する ID を記載することができます。

Attribute.Name: sulfate
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfate

Attribute.Name: sulfide
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfide

Attribute.Name: Fhost
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: tidal stage
Attribute.Description: stage of tide

Attribute.Name: total carbon
Attribute.Description: total carbon content

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: turbidity
Attribute.Description: turbidity measurement

Attribute.Name: water content
Attribute.Description: water content measurement

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを採取した場所の標高。平均海面からの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert，taiga，deciduous woodland。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 局所的な環境。例：harbor，cliff，lake。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air，soil，water。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: agrochemical additions
Attribute.Description: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

Attribute.Name: aluminium saturation
Attribute.Description: aluminum saturation (esp. for tropical soils)

Attribute.Name: aluminium saturation method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 海抜上の地表面から空中にあるサンプルを採取した位置までの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: annual and seasonal precipitation
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal precipitation (mm)

Attribute.Name: annual and seasonal temperature
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal temperature (degree Celsius)

Attribute.Name: crop rotation
Attribute.Description: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Attribute.Name: current land use
Attribute.Description: present state of sample site

Attribute.Name: current vegetation
Attribute.Description: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

Attribute.Name: current vegetation method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in vegetation classification

Attribute.Name: drainage classification
Attribute.Description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Attribute.Name: extreme event
Attribute.Description: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

Attribute.Name: extreme salinity
Attribute.Description: measured salinity

Attribute.Name: FAO classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

Attribute.Name: fire
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: heavy metals
Attribute.Description: heavy metals present and concentrations of any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

Attribute.Name: heavy metals method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: horizon
Attribute.Description: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

Attribute.Name: horizon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the horizon

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: link to classification information
Attribute.Description: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

Attribute.Name: link to climate information
Attribute.Description: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: local classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local classification method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass
Attribute.Description: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometers. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: pH method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining pH

Attribute.Name: pooling of DNA extracts
Attribute.Description: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

Attribute.Name: previous land use
Attribute.Description: previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: previous land use method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: profile position
Attribute.Description: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected, sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: salinity method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining salinity

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.Description: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: slope aspect
Attribute.Description: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315°. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

Attribute.Name: slope gradient
Attribute.Description: commonly called "slope". The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.Name: soil type
Attribute.Description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: soil type method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 核酸抽出とシークエンスに使用された実験材料に対する ID。採取された元々の材料，もしくは，そこから派生したサンプルを参照する ID を記載することができます。

Attribute.Name: storage conditions
Attribute.Description: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.Name: texture
Attribute.Description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: texture method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.Name: tillage
Attribute.Description: note method(s) used for tilling

Attribute.Name: total N method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the total N

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: water content of soil
Attribute.Description: water content (g/g or cm3/cm3)

Attribute.Name: water content of soil method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: タイトルはサンプルをよく表す簡潔なものを記入します。 タイトルはアカウントから登録されたサンプルにおいてユニークである必要があります。 例: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: NCBI Taxonomy database，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: environment biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert，taiga，deciduous woodland。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 局所的な環境。例：harbor，cliff，lake。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: environment material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ, http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq_e.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air，soil，water。FAQ，http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/faq.html#biome-feature-material EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: http://www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: biochemical oxygen demand
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chemical oxygen demand
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: efficiency percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

Attribute.Name: emulsions
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

Attribute.Name: gaseous substances
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: industrial effluent percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

Attribute.Name: inorganic particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: organic particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: pretreatment
Attribute.Description: the process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

Attribute.Name: primary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

Attribute.Name: reactor type
Attribute.Description: anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample storage duration
Attribute.Description: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: sample storage location
Attribute.Description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: sample storage temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction

Attribute.Name: secondary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

Attribute.Name: sewage type
Attribute.Description: type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial

Attribute.Name: sludge retention time
Attribute.Description: the time activated sludge remains in reactor

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: soluble inorganic material
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

Attribute.Name: soluble organic material
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 核酸抽出とシークエンスに使用された実験材料に対する ID。採取された元々の材料，もしくは，そこから派生したサンプルを参照する ID を記載することができます。

Attribute.Name: suspended solids
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter, etc,; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: Fhost
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: tertiary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total phosphate
Attribute.Description: total amount or concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: wastewater type
Attribute.Description: the origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in samples submitted from a submission account.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。

Attribute.Name: sample title

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: NCBI Taxonomy database，http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Taxonomy/Browser/wwwtax.cgi?mode=Undef&id=12908&lvl=3&lin=f&keep=1&srchmode=1&unlock). If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.

Attribute.Name: bioproject accession
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.Description: microbial or eukaryotic strain name
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 微生物や真核生物の株名。

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.Description: Identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルの得られた individual isolate

Attribute.Name: beta-lactamase family
Attribute.Description: Specify the beta-lactamase family for this gene.

Attribute.Name: carbapenemase
Attribute.Description: Does the enzyme exhibit carbapenemase activity? If the enzyme does exhibit carbapenemase activity, the response should be "yes", otherwise "no."

Attribute.Name: EDTA inhibitor tested
Attribute.Description: Was carbapenemase activity tested in the presence of EDTA? If carbapenemase activity was tested in the presence of EDTA, the response should be "yes", otherwise "no”.

Attribute.Name: collected by
Attribute.Description: Name of persons or institute who collected the sample
Attribute.DescriptionJa: 標本個体を採集した人物、または、団体の名称

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from the list, http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルを得た地域。国，大洋，または，海，の名称を次のリストから選択します，http://www.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/sub/country-e.html コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa，Hakone，Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが取得された生物の (ラボではなく) 自然界での宿主。"Homo sapiens" のように学名を記載。

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する，物理的，環境的，かつまたは，地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: lab host
Attribute.Description: Scientific name and description of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism or material from which the sample was obtained, e.g., Escherichia coli DH5a, or Homo sapiens HeLa cells
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが得られた生物や実験材料をラボで増殖させるために使われた宿主の学名。例: Escherichia coli DH5a，Homo sapiens HeLa cells

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 47.94 N 28.12 W
Attribute.DescriptionJa: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E) (例: 47.94 N 28.12 W) 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。
